+040: def estimate_balance(G: nx.Graph, samples: int, p: float | None = None, seed:int|np.random.Generator|None=None) -> tuple[NDArray[np.float64], NDArray[np.float64], NDArray[np.float64], NDArray[bool], NDArray[bool], NDArray[bool], NDArray[np.int32], NDArray[np.int32], NDArray[np.int32]]:
/* Python wrapper */
static PyObject *__pyx_pw_10py_raccoon_16balance_sampling_1estimate_balance(PyObject *__pyx_self, 
#if CYTHON_METH_FASTCALL
PyObject *const *__pyx_args, Py_ssize_t __pyx_nargs, PyObject *__pyx_kwds
#else
PyObject *__pyx_args, PyObject *__pyx_kwds
#endif
); /*proto*/
PyDoc_STRVAR(__pyx_doc_10py_raccoon_16balance_sampling_estimate_balance, "\n    Estimates the number of simple cycles in G using spanning-tree-based sampling.\n\n    Originally designed for Erd\303\266s-R\303\251nyi Graphs, but is still relatively accurate on many other graphs.\n\n    Parameters:\n    - G: Graph to estimate the number of simple cycles for\n    - samples: Number of spanning trees to sample for the estimation. More samples lead to a more accurate estimation.\n    - p: Edge Probability used for generating G (assuming Erd\303\266s-R\303\251nyi). Will be inferred if not specified.\n    - seed: Random seed or generator to use. Will generate a new `numpy.random.default_rng` if number or no seed is specified.\n\n    Returns: log_cycle_counts, is_zero, length_occurred\n\n    - log_cycle_counts: np.ndarray of length n + 1. Position l contains the log of the estimated number of cycles of length l.\n    - is_zero: np.ndarray of length n + 1. Position l is True if the estimated number of cycles of length l is 0.\n    - length_occurred: np.ndarray of length n + 1.  041:     """
 042:     Estimates the number of simple cycles in G using spanning-tree-based sampling.
 043: 
 044:     Originally designed for Erdös-Rényi Graphs, but is still relatively accurate on many other graphs.
 045: 
 046:     Parameters:
 047:     - G: Graph to estimate the number of simple cycles for
 048:     - samples: Number of spanning trees to sample for the estimation. More samples lead to a more accurate estimation.
 049:     - p: Edge Probability used for generating G (assuming Erdös-Rényi). Will be inferred if not specified.
 050:     - seed: Random seed or generator to use. Will generate a new `numpy.random.default_rng` if number or no seed is specified.
 051: 
 052:     Returns: log_cycle_counts, is_zero, length_occurred
 053: 
 054:     - log_cycle_counts: np.ndarray of length n + 1. Position l contains the log of the estimated number of cycles of length l.
 055:     - is_zero: np.ndarray of length n + 1. Position l is True if the estimated number of cycles of length l is 0.
 056:     - length_occurred: np.ndarray of length n + 1. Position l contains the number of times a cycles of length l was encountered during the sampling process.
 057:     """

Length of the array is number of nodes in `G` plus one.\n    ");

 071: @cython.wraparound(False)
 072: def estimate_len_count_fast(G: nx.Graph, edges: np.ndarray[NP_EDGE], p: float, samples: int, seed: np.random.Generator) -> tuple[NDArray[np.float64], NDArray[np.float64], NDArray[np.float64], NDArray[np.int32], NDArray[np.int32], NDArray[np.int32]]:
 073:     """
 074:     Estimates the number of cycles in `G` for each length.
 075: 
 076:     For the estimation, it simulates a sampling of cells with probability $P = 1$.
 077:     The number of cells for each length is then the sum of the resulting sampling probability $p'_c$ (which may be greater than 1).
 078: 
 079:     **Parameters**
 080:     G:          the graph
 081:     p:          edge probability on G
 082:     samples:    number of spanning trees to sample
 083: 
 084:     Returns: array of count, indexed by length. Length of the array is number of nodes in `G` plus one.
 085:     """

 167:     """
 168:     Estimates the probability with which each cycle induced by the given spanning tree appears in a uniformly sampled spanning tree.
 169: 
 170:     Due to limitations of floating point numbers, it returns the logarithm of the result.
 171: 
 172:     **Parameters**
 173:     G:      underlying ER-Graph
 174:     p:      edge probability of G
 175:     parent: parent relationship on the spanning tree T (root has parent -1)
 176:     depth:  distance of node from the root in T
 177: 
 178:     Returns: List of tuples (u, v, lca(u,v), log_2(p_c)) for each $(u, v) \in G \setminus T$
 179:     """
